prompt: <description>**CAD Model Instructions** **Part 1** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5, 0.0] Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.625] - Line 3: [0.75, 0.625] to [0.0, 0.625] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.625] to [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the rotation and translation defined by the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.5 units. **Part 2** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.2818, 0.0, 0.625] Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.4682, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.4682, 0.0] to [0.4682, 0.2859] - Line 3: [0.4682, 0.2859] to [0.0, 0.2859] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.2859] to [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.4682. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the rotation and translation defined by the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the negative Z-axis to a depth of 0.5 units, effectively cutting the material from the solid. **Part 3** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 2 units by 2 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.75, 0.0, 0.125] Create a 2D sketch on the Y-Z plane of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.2859, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.2859, 0.0] to [0.2859, 0.5] - Line 3: [0.2859, 0.5] to [0.0, 0.0] Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the rotation and translation defined by the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the X-axis to a depth of 0.5 units, effectively joining the material to the solid.</description>
